ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Extracting title attribute and linktext of an HTML-anchor
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm, I m not sure.  I m guessing that it does, so yes, if heritrix manages to pull down a gigantic HTML document, then HTMLParser could run out of memory.

Hmm, I'm not sure.  I'm guessing that it does, so yes, if heritrix 
manages to pull down a gigantic HTML document, then HTMLParser could run 
out of memory.  Also, you interact with it via Strings, so if you have a 
string larger than available memory, you're still in trouble there.

There is a chance that it doesn't load the entire document, since most 
of the interaction is based on visitors that walk the HTML.  I just 
haven't used it enough (or looked at the code) so I don't know.  For 
safety, it's best to assume that the entire document is read into a 
String at some point.

Good luck!
Micah

Christian Krumm wrote:
> Hi Micah,
> 
> I'll give HTMLParser a try.
> Do you have encounted any problems on a larger scale crawl useing 
> HTMLParser?
> HTMLParser reads the whole document into memory for parsing (like 
> Jericho), correct me if I am wrong,
> so it has an inherent OOME risk.
> 
> Christian
> 
> 
> Micah Wedemeyer schrieb:
>> I use HTMLParser ( http://htmlparser.sourceforge.net/ ) for all the HTML 
>> processing I need.  Using that, it should be fairly straightforward to 
>> write a processor that extracts the attributes you require.  There may 
>> be built-in heritrix code to help with that sort of stuff, but I never 
>> really looked all that close.
>>
>> Micah
